name: Le Jardin d'Essai du Hamma
description: An 80-hectare garden designed in 1832 with exotic flora, research facilities, and historical significance (site of the 1932 Tarzan film). Features Moorish-inspired pavilions and shaded pathways.

name: Bardo Museum
description: Housed in a 19th-century Ottoman palace, showcases prehistoric artifacts, traditional costumes, and Roman mosaics. Highlights include Berber jewelry collections.

name: Notre Dame d'Afrique
description: Neo-Byzantine basilica (1872) offering panoramic bay views. Features a silver statue of the Virgin Mary and interfaith inscriptions in French/Arabic.

name: Casbah of Algiers
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with Ottoman-era palaces, mosques, and labyrinthine streets. Key landmarks: Ketchaoua Mosque (1612) and Dar Hassan Pacha.

name: Martyrs' Memorial (Maqam Echahid)
description: A monument commemorating Algeria's independence struggle, featuring three palm leaves and an eternal flame

name: Ketchaoua Mosque
description: A blend of Moorish and Byzantine styles, originally a mosque, then a cathedral, and now a mosque again

name: Palais des Raïs
description: A 16th-century palace showcasing Ottoman grandeur, located in the lower Casbah

name: Garden of Prague
description: Known for its vibrant street art portraits and parakeets, offering a lively atmosphere.

name: Djamaâ El-Djazaïr
description: The third-largest mosque in the world, featuring the world's tallest minaret at 265 meters. It includes a prayer hall for 120,000 worshippers, a one-million book library, and a museum of Islamic art.

name: La Grande Poste d'Alger
description: A masterpiece of neo-Moorish architecture, now housing the Museum of Post and Telecommunications. Features intricate geometric patterns and vaulted ceilings.
unique_feature: Historical significance as a colonial-era post office.

name: Teri Park
description: An indoor amusement park featuring children's rides, climbing games, a 4D theater, and a food court.

name: Musée des Beaux-Arts d'Alger
description: Features a diverse collection of Algerian and international art, including works from the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: Port Sidi Fredj
description: A scenic port area with historical significance as the site of the French landing in 1830. Offers beautiful views and seafood restaurants.

name: Tipaza Roman Ruins
description: Coastal UNESCO site with 3rd-century Christian basilica, Roman theater, and thermal baths. Notable for Phoenician-Roman fusion architecture.

name: Royal Mausoleum of Mauretania (Kbour-er-Roumia)
description: Ancient mausoleum believed to be the tomb of King Juba II and Queen Cleopatra Selene.

name: Fort Santa Cruz
description: 16th-century Spanish fortress complex with chapel and underground tunnels. Offers views of Murdjajo Mountain and Oran Bay.

name: Bey's Palace
description: 18th-century palace showcasing Ottoman architecture. Features intricate tilework and historical artifacts.

name: Ahmed Zabana National Museum
description: Features artifacts from ancient civilizations, including Roman mosaics and prehistoric tools.

name: Cathedral of the Sacred Heart of Oran
description: Roman and Byzantine landmark now serving as a public library and cultural center.

name: Oran Sea Front
description: Picturesque coastal area with stunning views and a vibrant atmosphere.

name: Canastel Forest
description: Tranquil forest area ideal for hiking and relaxation.

name: Regional Theater of Oran
description: Cultural center hosting local plays and concerts.

name: Centre Commercial et de Loisirs Es-Senia
description: A modern shopping and leisure center featuring 120 stores, 3 cinemas, a bowling alley, kids' park, library, and hypermarket. Offers a diverse dining experience with 23 restaurants.

name: AZ Mall Grand Oran
description: A shopping mall offering a variety of retail stores, dining options, and entertainment facilities.

name: Great Mosque of Tlemcen
description: Built in 1082, this mosque is a highlight of Tlemcen's Islamic heritage.

name: Al Mechouar Palace
description: A Zianide Royal Palace with a rich history dating back to 1145.

name: Mansourah Ruins
description: Remains of a 14th-century citadel built by the Merinid dynasty.

name: Lalla Setti Plateau
description: Offers panoramic views of Tlemcen from a height of 1000 meters.

name: Beni Add Cave
description: A natural cave located about 30 minutes from Tlemcen.

name: El Ourit Waterfalls
description: A scenic waterfall area ideal for hiking and relaxation.

name: Marsa Ben M'hidi Beach
description: A coastal area with beaches and scenic views.

name: Timgad Ruins
description: Complete Roman grid city (100 AD) with 3,500-seat theater, Trajan's Arch, and advanced drainage systems. Called 'Algerian Pompeii'.

name: M'Zab Valley
description: UNESCO site with pentagonal Ibadi mosques and cliffside granaries. Includes five fortified ksour (villages) dating to 11th century.

name: Cap Carbon
description: Dramatic limestone cliffs with 1906 lighthouse. Hiking trails connect to Aokas coastal caves and Gouraya National Park.

name: Constantine
description: ‘City of Bridges’ featuring Sidi M’Cid suspension bridge (1912) and Palais d'Ahmed Bey. Historic Jewish quarter with Ottoman architecture.

name: Tassili n'Ajjer
description: UNESCO World Heritage sandstone plateau with 15,000+ Neolithic rock engravings. Features 'Crying Cow' and 'Swimming People' art sites.

name: Djemila
description: Best-preserved Roman town in North Africa with Capitolium temple, 3,000-seat theater, and mosaic-filled Christian quarter.
